senses.sense_definition: One of a set of choices that can be made.

examples.text: We have several <w>options</w> for dinner tonight.
Please select an <w>option</w> from the menu on the screen.

senses.sense_definition: The freedom or right to choose.

examples.text: You have the <w>option</w> to work from home on Fridays.
He had no <w>option</w> but to apologize for his mistake.

senses.sense_definition: A contract giving the holder the right to buy or sell an asset at a set strike price.

examples.text: The company offered stock <w>options</w> to its senior employees.
Investors can buy a call <w>option</w> if they expect the price to rise.

senses.sense_definition: The acquiring or retention of a nationality through personal choice as a right, especially when territory changes hands.

examples.text: Residents were given the <w>option</w> to retain their original citizenship.
The treaty included a right of <w>option</w> for the inhabitants of the transferred region.

senses.sense_definition: To purchase the rights to something, typically a book or script, for potential future production.

examples.text: The studio <w>optioned</w> the novel shortly after it became a bestseller.
They have <w>optioned</w> the script but haven't started filming yet.

senses.sense_definition: To configure a device or system by setting specific features or preferences.

examples.text: The server must be <w>optioned</w> correctly to handle the new software.
He bought a car that was fully <w>optioned</w> with all the latest technology.
